content:
IInputLanguageSource Interface

Definition

Defines necessary facilities for an object that intends to behave as an input language source.

In this Article

public interface IInputLanguageSource

Remarks

Implement this interface on a class that intends to behave as an input language source.

Use the RegisterInputLanguageSource method to register an input language source with an InputLanguageManager.

Properties

CurrentInputLanguage

Gets or sets the current input language for this input language source object.

public System.Globalization.CultureInfo CurrentInputLanguage { get; set; }
Value
CultureInfo

A CultureInfo object representing the current input language for this input language source object.

Remarks

When implemented by a class, this property should provide facilities for setting a new current input language on the input language source object, and for retrieving the currently active input language from the input language source object.

InputLanguageList

Gets a list of input languages supported by this input language source object.

public System.Collections.IEnumerable InputLanguageList { get; }
Value
IEnumerable

An enumerable object that represents the list of input languages supported by this input language source object.

Remarks

When implemented by a class, this property should return an object that implements the IEnumerable interface, and that supports enumerating a collection of CultureInfo objects, each representing a supported input language.

Methods

Initialize()

Initializes an input language source object.

public void Initialize ();

Remarks

When implemented by a class, this method should perform any initialization actions that are necessary for the object to behave as an active input language source.

Uninitialize()

Un-initializes an input language source object.

public void Uninitialize ();

Remarks

When implemented by a class, this method should perform any relevant cleanup actions prior to the class being discarded as an active input language source.
